selected_quotes: Not all loops form by extrusion. Kudos @thisissuhas @theaidenlab and many great collaborators.

wow cool paper by the aiden lab

facebook.title: Cohesin Loss Eliminates All Loop Domains, Leading To Links Among Superenhancers And Downregulation Of Nearby Genes | bioRxiv
facebook.summary: biorxiv.org   The human genome folds to create thousands of intervals, called “contact domains,” that exhibit enhanced contact frequency within themselves. “Loop domains” form because of tethering between two loci - almost always bound by CTCF and cohesin

This month featured a host of preprints on plants, stem cells, connectomi
